Show HN: I built a "Headless CMS" for my resume (Next.js and Puppeteer)
articles.description:
I got tired of maintaining resume_google.docx, resume_amazon.docx, and resume_v5_final.pdf.

Version control for resumes is broken. So I built a "Single Source of Truth" system.

The Logic:

The Database: You dump everything (all projects, 10 years of history) into one JSON-like structure.

The Query: You paste a Job Description.

The Render: The system "queries" your history for matching skills/bullets and renders a tailored 1-page PDF using a custom Puppeteer engine.

Itâ€™s basically CI/CD for job applications.

Tech Stack:

Next.js 15 (App Router)

NestJS (Backend logic)

Puppeteer (Custom rendering engine to fix page-break issues)

Live Demo: https://resumefy.pro

Iâ€™m open to roasting on the code or the "matching" logic.

articles.title: Velocity Coding
Show HN: Free API for REVE EEG Foundation Model
articles.description:
I built a REST API for REVE (the 60K-hour EEG foundation model released in October). It's free to use: https://web-production-73111.up.railway.app/docs

Use case: If you're building anything with EEG and don't want to deploy the model yourself, just hit the API with raw signals and get back embeddings.

Also working on training a better model on private data from devices/ labs. If you're collecting EEG data and want to partner, DM me.

Feedback welcome!

Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=46258343

articles.title: Show HN: I built a small tool to track receipts and warranty dates
articles.description:
I kept losing receipts and missing warranty deadlines, so I built this tool for myself.

The idea is simple: You forward purchase emails, and it extracts receipt details (store, amount, warranty dates) and reminds you before warranties expire. Also there is manual data entry, pdf drag and drop too

Itâ€™s intentionally small and boring, but useful. Built with Go and React.

Happy to answer questions.
